column11: fix  bug 63392

Oracle docs defines three versions of utf8 encoding.
- AL32UTF8 and UTFE character can occupy up to 4 bytes.
- UTF8 character can occupy up to 6 bytes.

column11: Fix php cli (-S option) inconsistent port parsing
column12:
## Description

The php cli server (-S) option parser uses strtol(3) to retrieve the port
from address argument. Therefore, htons(3) is used to normalize the
address port, which leads to an unverified cast.

The issue may appear trivial, therefore, assumi

column11: Bug #34380: preserve errno for stream_select and stream_socket_pair
column12:
When the system calls underneath stream_select() and stream_socket_pair()
fail, errno is logged but is not preserved. This change preservers errno in
posix_globals to allow the caller to query posix_get_last_error() to determine
the cause of the failure.

column11: Opcache: Fix segfault while pre-evaluating a disabled function
column12:
Opcache pass 1 accesses func->module in the "pre-evaluate constant functions"-step. However if the function has been disabled func->module will be NULL.

I think this will fix https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=68104

column11: Fixes setcookie to only send one Set-Cookie header per name
column12:
According to the IETF RFC 6265, only one Set-Cookie header should be sent per cookie name.

Fixes https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=67736

Cherry-picks and adapts 208deda (#795) for master

column11: Fix bug #68532: convert.base64-encode omits padding bytes
column12:
The memory stream will now read as much as possible and only set the EOF when you try to read when there is nothing left.
This is the way file streams do it and apparently some filter algorithms as convert.base64-encode depend on it.

column11: Crypt error-condition fixes
column12:
Crypt is currently documented to fail if provided invalid salts for STD_DES. The current implementation does not do so.

This can cause `crypt` to become silently insecure by falling back to STD_DES if there is a mistake in the salt format for another alg

column11: Use byebug instead of debugger for ruby 2.x support

`bundle install` will fail on the project with ruby 2.x versions because the debugger gem does not support it.
I recommend using byebug instead.

Have a nice day!

column11: Add reduce to deopted methods
column12:
All of our currently deoptimized Underscore methods (`pick`, `omit`, `invoke`, `without`, and `difference`) change behavior based on the number of arguments pass to the call. This both adds `reduce` (and friends).

Supersedes (and incorporates) #3810.

equal(col.reduce(function(a, b) {ret

column11: The attributes argument defaults to an empty object if the Backbone.View
column12: The attributes argument defaults to an empty object if the Backbone.View is instantiated without attributes. Trying to set an empty object as attributes of an element gives an error in jQuery 1.5.2 (only one tested)

column11: clear maintains id and id attribute
column12: Model#clear removes all attributes, while maintaining `model.id`.  `attributes.id` should be maintained with `model.id` and the docs should reflect this.

column11: unset properties not being returned by changedAttributes

Hi there,

It more or less says it in the title - after calling unset the unset attributes are not returned from calls to changedAttributes.

Attached are my two commits to test for & fix this bug.

Thanks,
Steve

Cheers,

When single quotes are used for attribute values, user input containing unescaped single quotes cannot be trusted.

Backbone uses `this` inside its closure to access jQuery or Zepto. If Backbone itself is wrapped inside another closure (say, a CommonJS module wrapper), it won't be able to access the global scope through `this`.

Here's a patch that passes along the cur

column11: Pass Collection#fetch options along to refresh
column12: Super simple, passes Collection#fetch options along to refresh or add. Matches the behavior of Model#fetch.

column11: Fix and test for recursion error when saving from within a change callback
column12:
Unless you pass the silent option to model.save() from within a change callback you will always get a recursion error. 

This is a small fix that avoids calling model.set() from within model.save() unless new attributes were actually passed to model.save(

column11: Remove duplicate backbone.localStorage docs

column11: Use JSONP in the github demo
column12:
I'm not sure how other browsers handle XHRs from `file:///`, but Chrome considers an XHR to `http://github.com` to be in violation of the Same Origin Policy. I had to change the demo to use JSONP to make it work.

Cheers,

Nick

test/DoS_tests.cpp:29

column11: [0.12] Disable bad-chain alert

Better to disable now until this can be fixed more thoroughly in the next release.

Discussed at 2016-03-31 IRC meeting.

Refs: #7568

A dump may look like:

VERSION=3
format=bytevalue

db_pagesize=4096
HEADER=END
<{Data}>
DATA=END
```

So the current parser gives us odd data like:

`keyHex=

I think this needs to be backported to 0.11 as well.

column11: Fix mempool packages

column11: Backport bugfixes to 0.10

column11: Fix locking in GetTransaction.
column12: GetTransaction needs to lock cs_main until ReadBlockFromDisk completes because the data inside CBlockIndex's can change since pruning.  This lock was held by all calls to GetTransaction except rest_tx.

column11: Fix removal of timelocked-txn from mempool during reorg
libbitcoinconsensus: avoid a crash in multi-threaded environments
column12:
tl;dr: EC_KEY_new_by_curve_name() affects global state in some versions/configs of openssl, leading to crashes when called by multiple threads. Avoid the issue by only calling it once at startup and caching the resulting group.

This is likely unnecessary

column11: Make sure we re-acquire lock if a task throws
column12:
This fixes #6394

Pretty simple, it just makes sure to re-acquire the lock in case f throws, so that we don't touch nThreadsServicingQueue without the lock. The empty throw statement re-raises the current exception.

column11: Fix masking of irrelevant bits in address groups.

column11: Do not store more than 200 timedata samples.
column12:
As reported in the issue #6490, Bitcoin Core keeps and extends `std::set` of `CNetAddr` for all peers during the whole server run. Even for peers that do not affect the adjusted time of the Core at all.

This change makes it clear (do nothing after 200 ti

Also adds test coverage.

column11: Test whether created sockets are select()able

column11: Prevent peer flooding inv request queue (redux)
column12:
Removes a network attacker node's ability to indefinitely blind its peers to a block or transaction new to them, such as a double-spend generated by attacker.  The possible blinding interval is reduced to the getdata timeout (currently 2 minutes).

This v

column11: Fix argument parsing oddity with -noX
column12:
`bitcoind -X -noX` ends up, unintuitively, with `X` set.
(for all boolean options X)

This result is due to the odd two-pass processing of arguments. This patch fixes this oddity (by always taking the latter option setting) and simplifies the code at the

column11: fix crash on shutdown when e.g. changing -txindex and abort action

  pointer
- using a std::string in CDBEnv::EnvShutdown() prevents the problem

column11: Use best header chain timestamps to detect partitioning
column12:
The partition checking code was using chainActive timestamps
to detect partitioning; with headers-first syncing, it should use
(and with this pull request, does use) pIndexBestHeader timestamps.

Fixes issue #6251

in-between successive calls to FindNextBlocksToDownload could
cause the block to be unnecessarily re-requested.

The issue is that pindexLastCommonBlock is only updated on calls
to FindNextBlo

column11: Fix two problems in CSubnet parsing
column12:
Fix two CSubNet constructor problems:
- The use of `/x` where 8 does not divide x was broken, due to a bit-order issue
- The use of e.g. `1.2.3.4/24` where the netmasked bits in the network are not 0 was broken. Fix this by explicitly normalizing the netw

column11: Fix off-by-one error w/ nLockTime in the wallet

column11: Catch errors on datadir lock and pidfile delete
column12:
Prevents bad permissions (or other fs related problems) from resulting in hard crashes with cryptic messages on startup and shutdown.

Fixes issues like: #6018 #4059

column11: Parameter interaction: disable upnp if -proxy set
column12:
To protect privacy, do not use UPNP when a proxy is set. The user may still specify `-listen=1` to listen locally (for a hidden service), so don't rely on this happening via the `-listen` case.

Fixes #2927.

column11: Do not inv old or missing blocks when pruning
column12:
When responding to a getblocks message, only return inv's as
long as we HAVE_DATA for blocks in the chain, and only for blocks
that we are likely to not delete in the near future.

This fixes the issue mentioned here https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pul

column11: Avoid crash on start in TestBlockValidity with gen=1 (rework)
column12:
Replaces #6079.

When the internal miner is enabled at the start of a new node, there is an near instant assert in TestBlockValidity because its attempting to mine a block before the top checkpoint.

Also avoids a data race around vNodes.

column11: fix WIN32 boost::filesystem::path issues when using special chars for datadir path
column12:
fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6078

column11: Avoid crash on start in TestBlockValidity with gen=1.
column12:
When the internal miner is enabled at the start of a new node, there
 is an near instant assert in TestBlockValidity because its attempting
 to mine a block before the top checkpoint.

Also avoids a data race around vNodes.

column11: Fix removing of orphan transactions
column12: The transaction thats being accepted can't be an orphan otherwise it would have previously been accepted, so doesn't need to be added to the erase queue.  We also don't want to erase orphans that still have missing inputs.

column11: Keep mempool consistent during block-reorgs

This fixes a subtle bug involving block re-orgs and non-standard transactions.

Start with a block containing a non-standard transaction, and
one or more transactions spending it in the memory pool.

Then re-org away from that block to another chain that

column11: Fix InvalidateBlock to add chainActive.Tip to setBlockIndexCandidates

column12: There was a bug in InvalidateBlock that prevented setBlockIndexCandidates from being properly repopulated. This would prevent you from necessarily ending up on the best chain after calling invalidateblock.  I also added an RPC test.

column11: Sanitize command strings before logging them.

This could be used to play havoc with a terminal displaying the logs,
 especially with printtocons

Even though only one CCheckQueueControl exists at a time, one of the 
CCheckQueue threads may have

- a) change the argument (and property on SignatureChecker) to

Currently a payment request is only checked for expiration upon receipt.
It should be checked again immediately before sending coins to prevent
the user from paying to an expired invoice which would then req

This is a minimally invasive patch to shutdown on LevelDB read errors from the chainstate. The block index does not need similar protection, as it's only read at startup.

Should apply cleanly to 0.10 as well.

            if (bindAddress.is_v6())

column11: signrawtransaction: validate private key.

Actually check block headers received from peers.  If a peer sends headers with invalid PoW, they were accepted and added to the disk block index previously.  This would then lead to a failure in checking the PoW
during the next startup while loading the

column11: Fix coinbase-spend mempool inconsistency after reorgs
column12: We were previously not removing transactions from mempool during reorg if they spent a coinbase. While this broke the mempool-invariant of safe-to-put-in-next-block it doesnt matter as mining code double-checks anyway (unless you're running with -debug or

column11: Sleep-wait on genesis block during init with -reindex
column12: This is an alternative to #5078...instead of throwing when chainActive.Tip() is missing (breaking what has otherwise traditionally been a global assumption) we just wait until at least genesis has been imported (its always first).

column11: Reset setBlockIndexCandidates once block index db loaded
column12: Delete all entries in setBlockIndexCandidates that are worse than our new current block upon completion of the initial LoadBlockIndexDB.

column11: Fix -loadblock after partial IBD and init after kill -9
column12:
You can currently kill -9 during IBD and will not be able to restart.
Also, if you let IBD start and then try to -loadblock afterwards it will not connect any of the blocks.

column11: Fix IsInitialBlockDownload which was broken by headers first.

This fixes a problem with #3883.

The problem was chaining large transactions (transactions with lots of ins and outs) would make the berkeley db transaction log get very big, as the dependencies (TxIns) of a transaction might be re-written

column11: CWallet: fix mapAddress book update

column11: Fix CPU Usage bug when using -nolisten and have no connections.

column11: non-blocking connect (by phantomcircuit)
column12:
Use non-blocking connects, and a select() call to wait a predefined
time (5s by default, but configurable with -timeout) for either
success or failure. This allows much more connections to be tried
per time unit.

Based on a patch by phantomcircuit.

column11: Fix for small change outputs
column12:
With the separation of CENT and MIN_TX_FEE, it is now reasonable
to create change outputs between 0.01 and 0.0005, as these are
spendable according to the policy, even though they require a fee
to be paid.

Also, when enough fee was already present, every

column11: Remove send to IP address and IP transactions support
column12:
Remove send to IP transaction support, as it is insecure and would confuse users when used. 

An IP is a terrible identifier as it does not identify a person or organization. Furthermore, man-in-the-middle attacks are trivial as the internet has no "proof

column11: listaccounts with minconf param was broken!
column12:
Dumb bug:  listaccounts N ignores the N.

My only excuse is that this is a hard feature to test, because transactions confirmations just keep happening, at unpredictable times...

column11: Add time to category:move transactions
column12: Simple oversight.
